title: Audio Equalizer
description: Adjust frequency bands to enhance your audio

sections.title: About Audio Equalizer
content: An audio equalizer allows you to adjust the balance between frequency components of audio signals. Perfect for enhancing music, podcasts, and voice recordings.

sections.title: Equalizer Formula
content: Where $G$ = gain, $Q$ = quality factor (bandwidth), $f_0$ = center frequency
Shelf filter for bass/treble: different transfer function
Each band independently adjusts frequency response

sections.title: Frequency Bands
content: 32-125Hz (Bass): Deep bass, kick drums, bass guitar fundamentals
250-500Hz (Low-Mid): Warmth, body of vocals and instruments
1-2kHz (Mid): Presence, clarity of vocals and lead instruments
16kHz (Treble): Air, sparkle, cymbals and high harmonics

sections.title: EQ Tips
content: Boost frequencies sparingly - cutting is often more effective
Use narrow Q (bandwidth) for problem frequencies
Use wide Q for musical enhancement
Always check your changes in context with other tracks
Trust your ears over visual feedback

sections.title: Common Adjustments
content: Vocal Enhancement: Slight boost at 2-5kHz for presence
Bass Boost: Gentle boost at 60-100Hz for warmth
Brightness: Boost 8-12kHz for air and sparkle
Mud Removal: Cut 200-500Hz to clean up muddiness
